Literature Review: Valvular heart disease is a complex and multifaceted condition that affects millions of people worldwide. Recent advancements in our understanding of the pathophysiology of valvular heart disease have led to the development of new therapeutic approaches, which have improved patient outcomes. This review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge in the field of valvular heart disease, focusing on the impact of atrial fibrillation, strategies for global prevention of rheumatic heart disease, understanding and management of secondary mitral regurgitation, the updated classification of bicuspid aortic valve disease, recognition of heightened cardiovascular risk associated with moderate aortic stenosis, and the growing armamentarium of transcatheter therapies.
